info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 03 at 2:20PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL BEAVER... SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...NORTHERN ALLEGHENY...FAR NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EST... At 217 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Kennedy Township, Belluvue, Ross Township and surrounding portions of the North Hills. These storms were moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Pea-sized hail and wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail accumulations could briefly lead to slick roadways. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Shaler Township, Hampton Township, Robinson Township, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, Harrison Township, Economy, O`hara Township, Bellevue, Kennedy Township, Ambridge, Wexford, West View, Stowe Township, and McKees Rocks. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 31 and 47. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 61 and 76. Parkway North between mile markers 4 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 58 and 61. && MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
